description: Number of standard Young tableaux of type (n,n,n) whose (2,1) entry is odd.
references: For definition see James and Kerber, Representation Theory of Symmetric Group, Addison-Wesley, 1981, p. 107.
links: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
Index entries for sequences related to Young tableaux.
example: a(2) = 2 because the standard Young tableaux of type (2,2,2) whose (2,1) entry is odd are:+---+   +---+|1 2|   |1 2||3 5|   |3 4||4 6|   |5 6|+---+   +---+  - _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 28 2012
author: giambruno(AT)ipamat.math.unipa.it
extensions: Definition corrected by Amitai Regev (amitai.regev(AT)weizmann.ac.il), Nov 15 2006
More terms and offset corrected by _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 28 2012
